titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Myers G. Lowman papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Hoover Institution Archives Staff

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-07-14T08:22-0700

change.item: Revised to add link to digitized version of video at another institution and to create separate Sound Recordings and Motion Picture Film series (Sarah Patton).
Revised to update restriction and box sizes.
Descriptions of reformatted audiovisual items updated.
Corrected content; updated for OAC standards.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Myers G. Lowman Papers)//EN" "reg_364.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 99 manuscript boxes, 1 card file box, 11 envelopes, 3 motion picture film reels

did.abstract: Correspondence, memoranda, pamphlets, photographs, motion picture film, sound recordings, and clippings relating to communism and other leftist movements, the civil rights movement, and anti-communism, primarily in the United States.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Boxes 92-93 closed. The remainder of the collection is open for research.

Use copies of some sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view videos or films during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all audiovisual material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Myers G. Lowman papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1967.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, pamphlets, photographs, motion picture film, sound recordings, and clippings relating to communism and other leftist movements, the civil rights movement, and anti-communism, primarily in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoranda, reports, notes, pamphlets, clippings, and printed matter relating to communism in the United States collected by Lowman as Executive Secretary of Circuit Riders, Inc., arranged alphabetically by subject.

scopecontent.p: Sound tape reels. Titles taken from box labels.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Important coup against race exploitation by Communist Party apparatus. Direct infiltration under M. G. Lowman's arrangement.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material at Other Institutions
relatedmaterial.p: Ed Friend's Highlander Folk School film, Ed Friend visual materials, 1918-1990, Richard B. Russell Library for Political Research and Studies, University of Georgia, Athens, as presented in the Digital Library of Georgia.

dao.title: Four-day workshop (Labor Day) at Highlander Folk School

did.unittitle: San Francisco City Hall riots against House Committee on Un-American Activities,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Composite film made by newsmen and from other pictures of riots.

did.unittitle: Videotape interview of Ku King Chang, one of the most important Taiwan Chinese anti-communists,

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: M. G. Lowman's guest at Independence Hall, Knotts Berry Farm. Shows concern of Taipei in regard to the recent China policy of Nixon.
